passages.text: FY25 5% EPS beat, FY2outlookancelar with H1 likely pressured

Our Take: Pernod Ricard has delivered a \(5\%\) beat on FY25 EPS driven by better margin. Q424 organic sales at \(- 0.3\%\) was slightly ahead of consensus \((- 0.8\%)\) thanks to stronger Europe and Asia (ex. China & India), partly offset by a miss in the US at c. \(- 12\%\) (vs cons \(- 8.9\%\) ) impacted by a slower than expected improvement in sell- out. India \(+\) low- teens% (cons. \(+14.5\%\) ) and China declining high- teens (vs cons \(- 14.3\%\) ) were also below. Q4 beat was driven by slightly better Europe \(+1.5\%\) vs cons. \(+1.1\%\) (helped by growth in France and E. Europe), rest of Asia (notably Australia) and GTR - LDD (cons. \(- 16.6\%\) ). For FY25, organic EBIT growth beat at \(- 0.8\%\) (vs \(- 3.1\%\) ) cons) with EBIT of €2,951m \(3\%\) ahead of consensus on better gross margin delivery (COGS efficiencies) and structural cost savings \((- 4\%\) yoy). Leverage at end FY25 was in line at \(3.3x\) (cons \(3.3x\) ) while FCF was better than expected at €1,133m (cons. €995m). Looking ahead to FY26, management expects a transition year with "improving trends" in organic sales skewed to H2 (cons. \(+0.5\%\) ) and to "defend our organic operating margin to the fullest extent possible" (cons - 20bps). Management expects a decline in Q1 (cons. \(- 0.4\%\) ) with distributor inventory adjustment in the US, continued soft consumer demand and inventory adjustment in China and the impact of Maharashtra excise policy changes in India though noting Duty Free China resuming from Q2. Next, despite the beat we would expect limited changes to FY26 consensus EPS on lower organic sales/ EBIT26 growth given softer H1 sales outlook, higher FX headwinds and scope impact. Overall, a mixed picture with a welcome earnings beat but clearly a much weaker set up into H126 (with Q126 possibly down \(3\% +\) ) and expectations that RI could guide to LSD% organic EBIT for FY26 post Diageo outlook. While we would expect the shares to be supported by today's beat, this may be tough to sustain post a c17% rally from June lows and now trading on 16x PE26E.

Noteworthy Areas: 1) Q4 organic sales \(- 0.3\%\) (vs cons. \(- 0.8\%\) ) to €2,506m (1.6% above cons) with M&A above expectations at \(- 0.6\%\) (vs cons \(- 2.3\%\) ) and FX worse than expected at \(- 4.9\%\) (vs cons \(- 4.2\%\) ); 2) Q4- implied organic sales by key market: US c. \(- 12\%\) (cons. \(- 8.9\%\) ) with slower narrowing of the gap to market and market impacted by consumer confidence and economic moderation; China down high- teens (cons. \(- 14.3\%\) ) in a challenging macro environment and continuing weak consumer sentiment impacting demand (flagged strong decline in Q1 on inventory overhang post conclusion of antidumping); India \(+\) low- teens (cons \(+14.5\%\) ) underpinned by strong underlying consumer demand and premiumization; Europe \(+1.5\%\) (cons \(+1.1\%\) ) with dynamic Eastern Europe and growth in France, partly offset by declines in Germany and Spain; GTR sales - LDD% (cons. \(- 16.6\%\) ) impacted by suspension of Cognac imports in China Duty Free (expected to return Q226); 3) By category: Strategic International \(- 4\%\) ; Strategic Local \(+2\%\) , Specialty \(- 7\%\) , RTD \(+7\%\) ; 4) Organic FY25 EBIT margin \(+60\) bps (cons - 10bps). FCF €1,133m (cons. €995m) with closing 3.3x net debt/EBITDA (cons 3.3x; FY24: 3.1x).
PERP.PA, RI FP Price (27 Aug 25):€99.04 Price Target (Dec- 26):€120.00
European Food Producers, Household & Personal Care Products, Beverages & Tobacco
Specialist Sales contact details:
See page 5 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures.

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

- **Outlook & Guidance:** For FY26, management expects a transition year with "improving trends" in organic sales skewed to H2 (cons. +0.5%). Management expects a decline in Q1 (cons. organic sales -0.4%) with distributor inventory adjustments in the US, continued soft consumer demand and inventory adjustment in China and the impact of Maharashtra excise policy changes in India and China Cognac duty free only returning from Q2. On EBIT, management has guided to "defend our organic operating margin to the fullest extent possible" (cons -20bps). Within EBIT A&P is guided at c.16% of net sales (FY25 15.3%), and margin will be supported by strict cost control and efficiency initiatives. FX is expected to be significantly negative (cons -6% headwind). Cash conversion expected to improve further with strategic investments below €900m and strong operating working capital management. Management have reiterated the medium term framework for annual organic sales growth in the upper end of +3-6% and annual organic EBIT margin expansion.

- **Likely changes to consensus:** Despite the beat we would expect limited changes to FY26 consensus EPS on lower organic sales/EBIT FY26 growth given softer H1 sales outlook, higher FX headwinds and scope impact.
- **Valuation:** With shares -9% ytd vs the sector -2%, RI trades on 15.9x calendar 2026E P/E, a 3% premium to the sector on 15.4x and a 4% discount to International Spirits on 16.5x.
- **Conference Call Details:** Today at 09:00 CET/08:00 UK time. Dial-in: +44 121 281 8004. Webcast here.

Pernod- Ricard SA (Neutral; Price Target: €120.00)

In our view, the FY25 top- line growth and EBIT margin face downside risks amid continued weakness in the US, with still soft depletions, and in China, where consumer sentiment remains weak, further impacting Asia travel retail. We remain cautious on the Spirits segment overall and for Pernod, with risks to earnings amid weakening markets demand, normalising pricing and negative mix - admittedly sector- wide issues - while we await further clarity on actions Pernod will take to mitigate the China tariff impact. We see downside risks to timing a return to the lowered MT guide in the context of structural risks to Spirits demand. While we appreciate the company's LT opportunity to drive both top line and margin and the shares are now trading at a discount to the sector, we expect the shares to be held back in the near term by downside risks to earnings and the limitations of high leverage currently.

Our peer- multiple derived Dec- 26 PT is €120. We value the shares at 15x 2026E P/E, a \(10\%\) discount to International Spirits peers on calendar 2026E P/E (c.16x) given the greater risk profile (more EM exposure) for similar medium- term growth.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
